conclusion: A particle moves along two semicircular arcs, each with a radius of 1 meter, from point A to point C, taking 5 seconds.

The images show a particle moving along a path from point A to point C, consisting of two semicircular arcs: first semicircle from A to B (above the horizontal line) and second semicircle from B to C (below the horizontal line).
Each semicircle has a radius of 1 meter.
Displacement is the straight-line distance from start to finish (from A to C).

premise: Points A, B, and C all lie on the same horizontal line. B is located at a distance of 2 meters from A (diameter of first semicircle) and C is located at a distance of 4 meters from A (2m from A to B plus 2m from B to C).
conclusion: Displacement is 4 meters in the eastward direction.
The distance traveled is the total length of the path, which consists of two semicircles.

premise: Length of a semicircle = π × radius. Length of each semicircle = π × 1m = π meters.
conclusion: Total distance traveled = π + π = 2π meters ≈ 6.28 meters.
Average velocity is the displacement divided by the time taken.
Average velocity = 4 m / 5 s = 0.8 m/s eastward.
Average speed is the total distance traveled divided by the time taken.
Average speed = 2π m / 5 s = 2π/5 m/s ≈ 1.257 m/s.

premise: Average velocity: 0.8 m/s eastward, Average speed: 2π/5 m/s ≈ 1.257 m/s.
conclusion: Final Answer: Average velocity: 0.8 m/s eastward, Average speed: 1.256 m/s.
